snippet: Kayla Harrison was sexually abused by her judo coach when she was 13. She overcame that trauma and won the United States’ first gold in the sport.
abstract: Kayla Harrison wins first gold medal in judo for the United States; victory is remarkable for Harrison, who has faced far more in her young life than most can fathom, like sexual abuse by a coach when she was 13, and for a sport that is popular worldwide but remains obscure in the US; other American judo victories include Marti Malloy who won a bronze.
lead_paragraph: Kayla Harrison was sexually abused by her judo coach when she was 13. She overcame that trauma and won the United States’ first gold in the sport.

headline.seo: Kayla Harrison Overcame Horror to Win Judo Gold
headline.main: For Judo Champion, a Painful Path to Gold
headline.print_headline: Judo Gives Her Gold, but Also Gave Her Horror
